FIRST_HOSTILE: Ahh. This system is Zaurakian. They're bad. We could mine any unoccupied planets and sneak away. Or we could fight. I wouldn't recommend that, though - remember I die: You die. Oddly, the reverse is not the case so should you ever feel the need to step out of the airlock, I could get home safely. But anyway, best upgrade me a bit before you try and take a pop at anyone.
FIRST_NEUTRAL: Ok, these guys are Castorian - neutrals. We can trade with them but beyond that they aren't interested in helping. They've got great tech, tho, so don't pick a fight unless you'd like us to get smoked. If you want to trade, get close and initiate docking (get close and push 'w' on your console, in case you still haven't read my manual).
FIRST_FRIENDLY: Aha! These guys - the Alcorians - should be on our side. They're still fighting the Zaurakians, and they may be able to help us. Get close and dock (get close and push 'w' on your console, in case you still haven't read my manual). They may even join us! Be nice to have company. I mean, you meat-bags are ok, but you guys are sooooooooo slooooowwwww. I'd like another ship to chat with, you know - space-gossip.
FIRST_SISTERS: Oh, that's interesting - that's a Sister's Station. They're some quasi-religious-space-nun-thing. They have their own agenda, but we should be safe docking here. We can buy weapons, repair my armor and maybe pick up some crew. Be nice to have someone else to talk to.
FIRST_UNINHABITED: Ahhhh - no one here. A bit of peace and quiet. Go nuts.
FIRST_COMBAT:
We're entering combat. Good luck. Did you remember to switch off the coffee machine? It says here 'Entering combat, p3.4.23.6: Switch off the coffee machine.
Frankly if the worst thing that happens to you today is getting burned by hot coffee I think you'll have done ok.

In case you've forgotten what to do, and are too lazy to read my manual:
Weapons select: 1-5. Note only some weapons are homing (denoted by the crosshairs on the icon)
Right-click: Lock (homing weapons only)
Left-click: Fire
Spacebar to unpause

Again: Good Luck. I'll have my eyes closed.
FIRST_COMBAT_WITH_ALLIES:
You'll be familiar with most of this this, but now it gets hard. You'll know now how to drop in and out of the various relativities, but now you'll have to dance with others. Use your pause menu (realtime) to switch between your ships ([/]) to mark targets. You'll only need to actually fly one ship - just switch to the others to give orders.

Just remember: your remote ships can only use homing weapons, so make sure they have plenty of those before battle. You can dock with them to resupply mid-battle if needed.
FIRST_ENEMY_LAUNCH: Cap, I've just detected a long range launch. Looks like a Zaurakian on intercept with Polaris. They must be reinforcing the blockade.
FIRST_ENEMY_LAND: Cap, that ship I've been tracking has landed at Polaris. The Threat Level has increased. You might want to keep an eye on that.
FINAL_BATTLE: Ok Cap, here we go. You've chosen to go it alone so good luck. But I do have some good news! I can download myself from here, so I'll be fine.
FINAL_BATTLE_WITH_ALLIES:
Here we go Cap, this is it.

Might be a good idea to take a moment at an undefended planet to distribute ammo among your fleet before the battle.

Good luck. I've downloaded all my data to base. I wish I could do the same for yours.
FIRST_RECRUIT:
We now have company! Another ship will really help us out - we can cover more space.

A note on navigation:
In general you can switch ships by pushing ([/]) on your console. In Planetary and System views, you then control their ship. In Galaxy view however you can switch to their ships and issue orders, but they will only jump when you jump. Remember you're in hypersleep when you jump? Well, so are they, so you can't communicate.
FIRST_PLANET:
Mining is easy - just shoot the planet from within weapons range. Your weapon system won't matter too much, so stick to your lasers, which just take cap to fire. Do get into the habit of watching your cap, though, as running out during a battle is problematic.
Don't forget to pick up the cans the planet ejects. There's a bar on the top left that shows your progress.
FIRST_SYSTEM: We've arrived at our first system - hit Return on your console to descend, Esc to ascend. This works on all your viewscreens. Read my Manual should you forget again (bottom right).
FIRST_UPGRADE: We are making progress! We've collected enough resources to upgrade one of my systems. Hit F on your console to bring up my Fitting Menu. Be warned though, some upgrades are more useful than others, so it might be worth saving up.
HOSTILE_HOMEWORLD: This is the Zaurakian homeworld. Be very, very careful: This is where First Lord Zaurak himself is based, and his ship is heavily upgraded. He will make short work of us.
NEUTRAL_HOMEWORLD: The Alcorian homeworld, home to First Lord Alcor himself. His is the most heavily armed ship in his heavily armed fleet, so don't go picking any fights now.
FRIENDLY_HOMEWORLD: This is the Castorian homeworld. First Lord Castor should join our cause, and his ship's arms and armor should fight well alongside ours.
